Hello folks,

We checked our logs and currently we are getting the following error

2014-05-23 06:56:52,655 scheduler_Worker-5 ERROR [org.hibernate.util.JDBCExceptionReporter] Violation of UNIQUE KEY constraint 'UQ_cwd_memb_600FBEE147DBAE45'. Cannot insert duplicate key in object 'dbo.cwd_membership'. The duplicate key value is (426167, 1081391, GROUP_USER).

What is the reason for this and how can we clear this error
fields.summary: Crowd error
Allow searching for Original Estimate when using Basic Search

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38532].
  {panel}

h5. Introduction
*How user picker works*
* It figures out the group via Project -> Role -> Group (i.e. determines that the assignable users for project X are the users in the role Y, and therefore the users in the group Z).
* Uses the configured User Directories (AD, Crowd...) to get a list of users that belong to group Z.
* Matches the entered characters with the user name, the email address and display name.

*Can you change the interval*
Unfortunately no. It will do a request 75 millisecond after entering a character. If the user enters another character in that 75ms period, it will restart the timer. In other words, if the user types the name really fast, it won't do a search until the full name has been entered. A hacky way to force that behaviour is to write the username somewhere else, copy and paste it into the field: that will result in just one REST call.

*Will it cause performance issue*
Yes, It could cause performance problems. At least, there are a two potential problems:
* If the user has multiple User Directories, searching for the members of a group could be slow. Solution: reduce the number of User Directories and/or move the User Directory that will contain the requested group at the top of the chain.
* If the project has a very broad assignable group, (eg: all the users in JIRA are potentially assignable, but only a bunch of them are actually assigned), retrieving the list of users and matching the characters could be expensive. Solution: create a smaller assignable group, it is better to add users when needed, than to add lots of JIRA users that never get an issue assigned.

h5. Suggestion
It would be great if JIRA administrators can configure User Picker, for example the REST interval.
fields.summary: Allow better configuration of User Picker custom field

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38527].
  {panel}

In the user profile's activity stream it will send queries to the database to retrieve user activities. 

It's been noted, however, that getting the stream to populate can be extremely slow. Adding an index on the {{author}} column in the _changegroup_ table may speed up the query and get the activity steam populated faster. 

By default the schema for the  _changegroup_ table are:
{code:sql}
6.2.4=# \d changegroup
           Table "public.changegroup"
 Column  |           Type           | Modifiers
---------+--------------------------+-----------
 id      | numeric(18,0)            | not null
 issueid | numeric(18,0)            |
 author  | character varying(255)   |
 created | timestamp with time zone |
Indexes:
    "pk_changegroup" PRIMARY KEY, btree (id)
    "chggroup_issue" btree (issueid)
{code}

By adding an index on the {{author}} column performance of the query is anecdotally improved from 2-3 seconds to 0.02 seconds.

(!) *Note:* If customers wish to perform this operation themselves on their own database please understand that this involves customizing your standard JIRA database which falls out of our [Support Offerings|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Support/Atlassian+Support+Offerings]. If the customisation is thought to be the cause of any issues in your system you will be asked to restore your database back to its default state with the anticipation that functionality will return to default from there.
fields.summary: Add author column in the changegroup table to speed up query

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38519].
  {panel}

h3. ***Summary***
Minsk no longer observes daylight savings time (DST). The default timezone should be set to *UTC+3:00* instead of UTC+2:00.

h3. ***Expected Behaviour***
When choosing Minsk timezone as per the steps below, the timezone should be set to *UTC+3:00*
h4. Method 1
# Go to Administration > System > General Configuration
# Click on Edit Settings > Internationalization
# Choose default user time zone as Minsk

h4. Method 2
# Profiles > Preferences > Edit  
# Choose default user time zone as Minsk
!time.png!

h3. ***Actual Behaviour***
When choosing Minsk timezone as per the steps above, the timezone is set to UTC+2:00
fields.summary: Minsk Timezone is obsolete

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38511].
{panel}
Steps to reproduce the issue:
 * Create a new project
 * Create a security scheme, with only one security level that allows *Group (Anyone)* to view the issues:
 **   !Screen Shot 2021-01-11 at 1.56.46 pm.png|thumbnail!
 * Associate the security scheme to the project created
 * Create two issues on the new project:
 ** The first issue using the Security Level created
 ** The second issue without using any Security Level (set it to none)
 * Edit the permission scheme associated with the project and add *Group (Public)* to *Browse Projects* permission
 * Log out of the instance.
 * Go to the issue navigator and search for the issues in that project.
 * You will only view the issue that is not using the security level.
 * If you try to access the issue that uses the security level directly by the specific URL, you will be able to view it. It is not shown only in the issue navigator (reindex doesn't help either)

[*Update*] 
 This also effects access to issues via the new issue view, if the issue security level is set and new issue view is the default The below error will be displayed:
 !Screenshot 2019-06-19 at 10.32.33.png|thumbnail!

Workaround:
 - Set the *Security Level* to none
fields.summary: Anonymous users can’t browse the issues when they have Security Level granted to group Anyone
Issue Closed system field

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38495].
  {panel}

*Steps to Reproduce*
# Setup JIRA and Confluence installations with mostly similar user base, but having some JIRA users who cannot log in to confluence.
(i) Fastest way to do this is setting up confluence to use JIRA as a user server.
(i) A natural user case is scenario where confluence license user tier is lower than JIRA.
# In confluence Global Permissions grant anonymous 'Use' permission.
# Create a confluence space with anonymous 'View' permission, and create an unrestricted page in this space
# Login to JIRA with a user that doesn't have credentials to log on to confluence #* try to find the page or space created in the previous step.
#* From a service desk with a configured Knowledge Base, type in text contained in the Confluence space or page, while trying to raise a Request.

*Expected Results*
Since this space and Confluence global permission has granted anonymous view access, and this same users can actually view the same content by accessing confluence directly without needing to log-on to confluence, the content should be available to them when logged-on to JIRA.

*Actual Results*
* None of this anonymously accessible confluence content is available in either JIRA or Service Desk to logged-in JIRA users who don't have login credentials to JIRA.
* Only JIRA users who belong to groups that are specifically added to the 'can use' permission in Confluence, can see all the content granted to anonymous users.
fields.summary: Remote link to unrestricted confluence pages or spaces fails for JIRA users who do not have login credentials for confluence

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38487].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
There is no method to reset a Permission Scheme to factory Defaults. 

Occasionally, the Default Permission Scheme is modified in JIRA and this is unintentional. 

Otherwise, the permission scheme is modified, but this scheme becomes inappropriate for the use-case of JIRA and the Administrator would like to start from a clean slate. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide an option to reset the default permission scheme to default, or create a Default Permission Scheme from scratch instead of having to copy one. 
 
h3. Workaround
Manually reconfigure an Existing Permission Scheme.
fields.summary: Add reset button for permission schemes

*Expected result:*

*Actual result:*

We use a triage system that has QA add the priority for issues submitted through issue collectors. Issues submitted through the issue collector do Not have a priority (since the collector doesn't ask for it). 

When going to Projects > (select project) > Issues > No priority is not clickable, like the other priorities are. 

Request: Can "No Priority" be made linkable to an issue filter that lists issues without a priority? 

I am aware JRA-30051 removed the link but I would like to request that it be readded if there are issues with no priority.

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38469].

It is difficult to get Wallboards looking even good (let alone great).

One problem is the automatic sizing of the Slideshow presentation, which is not adjustable via browser zoom.

It is currently very tedious to experiment repeatedly with various combinations of layouts and widget placement to try to get everything actually visible on the screen, yet still big enough to be readable.

We are using a 16:9 screen (which most modern screens are).  Perhaps the wallboards were designed for and work better for the older standard ratio 4:3.

-Johnny

fields.description:
Add-ons that we disable are re-enabling themselves automatically.We have had the "Harvest TIme Tracking", "DonayIncentify" and "Quandora" add-ons enabled for a while but then disable them through the 'Manage Add-ons' page.

However, periodically (sometimes the next day, sometimes after a few days), the add-ons have re-enabled themselves. They are cluttering up our interface when creating/editing issues (as we no longer use them) as well as sucking up time having to disable them every time they pop back up.
fields.summary: Disabled Add-ons re-enabling automatically

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38452].
  {panel}

We have two sources of git repos indexed by FeCru - a gitosis server and a Stash server. Gitosis is set anonymous read, Stash is (of course) secured. 

If I create a new dashboard, populate it only with the Activity Feed, only pick Fisheye. However, only the Gitosis commits show up with the project name - the repo activity coming from Stash is missing the repo name. To clarify, Gitosis repos show up like this:
Joe Smith <joe.smith@company.com> committed changeset 9e83e95803c70d48a9b6d7e1a94e263485297e72 to the Super Mega Awesome project
The same repo in Stash would show up like this:
Joe Smith <joe.smith@company.com> committed changeset 9e83e95803c70d48a9b6d7e1a94e263485297e72 to the project

Please take a look when you can...
fields.summary: Activity feed data missing on Stash repos

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38444].
  {panel}

Whenever view the wallboard, the following messages appear in the JIRA logs:

{code}
2012-09-10 18:17:14,795 http-8513-1 INFO anonymous 1097x2226x1 derixc 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /s/en_GBxzig5g/782/3/1.7.3/_/download/resources/images/InCycleDashboardSmall.jpg [atlassian.plugin.webresource.SingleDownloadableResourceBuilder] Unable to find resource for plugin: images and path: InCycleDashboardSmall.jpg
2012-09-10 18:17:14,795 http-8513-14 INFO anonymous 1097x2229x4 derixc 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /s/en_GBxzig5g/782/3/1.7.3/_/download/resources/images/InCycleWallboardSmall.jpg [atlassian.plugin.webresource.SingleDownloadableResourceBuilder] Unable to find resource for plugin: images and path: InCycleWallboardSmall.jpg
2012-09-10 18:17:14,795 http-8513-10 INFO anonymous 1097x2227x2 derixc 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /s/en_GBxzig5g/782/3/1.7.3/_/download/resources/images/FlatDashboardSmall.jpg [atlassian.plugin.webresource.SingleDownloadableResourceBuilder] Unable to find resource for plugin: images and path: FlatDashboardSmall.jpg
2012-09-10 18:17:14,796 http-8513-11 INFO anonymous 1097x2230x5 derixc 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /s/en_GBxzig5g/782/3/1.7.3/_/download/resources/images/spinner_blanket.gif [atlassian.plugin.webresource.SingleDownloadableResourceBuilder] Unable to find resource for plugin: images and path: spinner_blanket.gif
2012-09-10 18:17:14,796 http-8513-9 INFO anonymous 1097x2228x3 derixc 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /s/en_GBxzig5g/782/3/1.7.3/_/download/resources/images/FlatWallboardSmall.jpg [atlassian.plugin.webresource.SingleDownloadableResourceBuilder] Unable to find resource for plugin: images and path: FlatWallboardSmall.jpg
{code}

The problem can reproduce after install the JIRA Wallboard Plugin and access through "Tools" > "View as Wallboard"  .It seems that no functionality of wallboard was affected. In addition, the image that unable to be located seems to be sample images of wallboard in the JIRA Wallboard Plugin.

h5. In Chrome:
Subsequent action on viewing the wallboard(Exit and View it again) will not given the stacktrace but the following session id message:
{code}
18:55:24,820 http-8513-13 INFO admin 1135x2951x1 1nr9vcg 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /plugins/servlet/Wallboard/ [atlassian.jirawallboard.servlet.WallboardServlet] Session id is: 58457B12137B59089EBC2C018A99CBF3
{code}

h5. In IE8 and Firefox 15:
Subsequent action on viewing on the wallboard(Exit and View it again) will generate the stacktrace respectively on every access.

h5. Consequences:
Although no functionality of wallboard was affected, however the stacktrace was rather annoying and makes the logs slightly unreadable when generated non stop if a lot of user try to access it(especially IE and Mozilla behaviour).
fields.summary: Extraneous logging shown in logs after view the wallboard

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38439].
{panel}
h3. Description

I love the way Jira integrates with its current development tools to create branches and code reviews. It would be even better if Jira natively supported Gitlab (Hosted or The Users Own Servers) just like it supports Stash/BitBucket/Github.

Gitlab is growing in terms of its user base and is definitely a source repository that should be supported out of the box.
h3. Workaround

You can either:
 * Use the [free app released by Gitlab|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1221011/gitlab-for-jira?hosting=cloud&tab=installation]. Please notice that *it is now possible to also use the free app to integrate with self-hosted Gitlab*, as documented in: [Install the GitLab.com for Jira Cloud app for self-managed instances|https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/integration/jira/connect-app.html#install-the-gitlabcom-for-jira-cloud-app-for-self-managed-instances]

 * Follow the instructions in [https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/user/project/integrations/jira.html]
 * Use any of the other app (free or paid) available on our marketplace: [https://marketplace.atlassian.com/search?hosting=cloud&product=jira&query=gitlab]
fields.summary: Gitlab Support
Remember last shown basic search fields, e.g. always show "resolution" for me

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38436].
  {panel}

Hi,
We have a Agile board (configured for project ABC, & filter is configured using JQL query like below):
project = "ABC" ORDER BY Rank ASC

Now, say project ABC has been renamed to XYZ, then you can't see any issues under Agile board since board still uses filter JQL query which points to old project with name ABC.

Solution looking: So actually if project is renaming from ABC to XYZ then it should reflect at each and every place including JQL filer query. I think this is an issue with jira & needs to be rectify.

Jira System should able to update name at each & every place in system, as its not possible for user to go & check/change in each and every board that used old project name.

JIRA Agile (v6.3.13.1)
Reference: JSP-193610

Regards,
- Vishal
fields.summary: Chaging project name doesn't reflect in Advance filter query
Limit the number of issue attachment

*Problem* 

When attempting to configure a custom field display from JIRA Agile, if you select 'ALL' then select 'Custom' again an error will appear. 

*Steps to reproduce* 

1. Open a board in JIRA Agile
2. Select a specific issue
3. Type 'E' to edit
4. Select Configure Fields
5. Select *All* from the drop down menu, then select *Custom* from the drop down menu. 
6. Error is displayed **Exception: Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'getId' of undefined**

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38429].
  {panel}

Try to use the REST browser with the following URL
https://jira.atlassian.com/plugins/servlet/restbrowser

The result is a page opened with two sections, 
the left one with a spinning loader in it

With a little further investigation, the problem is probably with a .js file not found and reports as 404
https://jira.atlassian.com/plugins/servlet/$webResourceManager.getStaticResourcePrefix()/download/resources/com.atlassian.labs.rest-api-browser:assets/rab/rest-api-browser.min.js

The URL includes some statement that doesn't expand to a value ("$webResourceManager.getStaticResourcePrefix()")

It's the same result in IE, Firefox and Chrome
fields.summary: Unable to access REST browser on jira.atlassian.com
Balsamiq Mockups 2.2.21 Update

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38423].
  {panel}

Currently, JIRA Service Desk have the feature to Creating/Searching a Knowledge Based topics out from its issues. But, this feature is restricted only for JIRA Service Desk issues.

Therefore, it would be great if this feature/button also available for JIRA Standard Issues.

*Related Notes:*

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38418].
  {panel}

Editing _User Property_ throws XSRF Security Token Missing, after trying to add a non-alphanumerical character as new _User Property_ key.

*Steps to reproduce*:
# Navigate to {{Administration > User Management > Users}}
# Search for a user and view the user profile
# Click the *Actions* button, and choose *Edit Properties*
# Add new *User Property* if there is none. Ex. key = *Color*, value = *Blue*
# Add another *User Property*, key = *>*, value = _anything_
It will fail as expected
# Click the *Edit* button to edit the existing *User Property*, and change it to any value

*Expected result:*
The value changed normally.

*Actual result:*
JIRA displayed XSRF Security Token Missing page. The value is changed afterwards.
fields.summary: XSRF Security Token Missing. The browser has provided ZERO parameters

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38416].
  {panel}

We have both Jira and Confluence in house today. 

Our requirements elaboration process is more or less like this: 

Whiteboard > Balsamiq > Axure > Jira epic > Jira user stories > Development > "Move content to Confluence for both description of business rules as well as the user manual". 

Some time after release the improvements are registered. Minor adjustments to make it just a little bit more user friendly, changes to the business rules, etc. This is normally done in Jira. However, we see very often that we forget to update the business rules section in Confluence. 

So we would like to change the process a little - to get down the requirements in Confluence first before we start creating Jira issues. And when we start creating Jira issues, we only reference certain placeholders or similar on a specific Confluence page. This will ensure that the content in Jira is updated continuously as there is only one true source of descriptions. 

This "one source" idea is used by eDevTech with their product InteGREAT that manages requirements gathering and management together with TFS.
fields.summary: As a user I would like to include specific content from a Confluence page in a Jira issue so that I only have one source for requirements descriptions

fields.description:
Hi, I am running a jql query:
((PROJECT = CDS AND issuetype in (milestone, Deliverable) AND "Workstream/Team" in cascadeOption(10415) AND iteration != OoS AND labels = keydependency) AND (status = "Open" OR (status changed from "Open" to "Iteration Done" OR status changed from "Iteration Done" to "Complete" after "-14d"))), the query is red, it doesnt like it, however the results are what I am after. I get 33 results.

If I run it like the below, I get 21 results but query is green, it accepts it.
(PROJECT = CUDOS AND issuetype in (milestone, Deliverable) AND "Workstream/Team" in cascadeOption(10415) AND iteration != OoS AND labels = keydependency) AND (status = "Open" OR status changed from "Open" to "Iteration Done" after ("-14d") OR status changed from "Iteration Done" to "Complete" after ("-14d"))

for some reason it is returning tickets with open status and iteration done, however, it is ignoring the remaining query. I have tried minimising brackets etc, and know there are issues changed to complete within 14 days however they are not displayed. 

Is there a limit with how long the query is, or limit of brackets? Also, the query is displayed as red/failed however runs.  There are 33 items that meet this search, however, 21 items are only displayed. its like it stops reading the remaining query once it satisfies one condition, however,the code is OR, not and.

I changed the order of it too, like:
(PROJECT = CUDOS  AND ((status changed from "Open" to "Iteration Done" after ("-14d")) OR (status changed from "Iteration Done" to "Complete" after ("-14d"))) AND (issuetype in (Milestone, Deliverable) AND "Workstream/Team" in cascadeOption(10415) AND iteration != OoS AND labels = keydependency)) but I only got 2 results!

Can someone please advise? I have the same query running over multiple projects (for their project) and it is not behaving as expected.
fields.summary: Issue with jql query, not returning correct results as expected
Disable Conditions, Validators & Post Functions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38412].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Attempting to edit an issue when the username is mixed-case and disabled is not possible as it displays the following errors:

* If they're the assignee: User cannot be assigned issues.
* If they're the reporter: The reporter specified is not a user.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a user with mixed-case username (e.g.: {{AquaMan}}).
# Create an issue and assign that user to it, and make them the reporter.
# Deactivate that user.
# Attempt to edit the issue.

h3. Expected Results

The issue is able to be saved.

h3. Actual Results

When saving the issue, the errors in the attached screenshot are presented and the issue cannot be saved.

h3. Workaround

This validation is not applied when using Inline Edit, so it's still possible to edit those fields in the issue. Alternatively, the user could be renamed to lower-case.

Removing the field from the Edit Screen is also a viable workaround.

h3. Notes

This happens for users in the JIRA Internal and Active Directory.
fields.summary: Unable to edit an issue when the user is deactivated

h3. Problem Description

Currently in JIRA comments posted by users can have invalid characters which can cause some problems later on when the data is retrieved for further analysis from Database or from issue exports. It will be great if it's possible to provide a validator that verfies the input text of a user and displays an error message durong posting such comment.

h3. Suggested Resolution

Provide a workflow validator to check user's input in a comment.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38401].
  {panel}

The new Issue Navigator/search behavior seems to have broken the workflow of our users and also a plug-in we use (E-mail this issue plug-in).

The little navigation on the right hand corner of the ticket (see attached screenshot) disappears the moment we exit the Issue Navigator.

How to reproduce:
1. Search for something
2. Click on the ticket ID above the ticket title. It should bring you out of Issue Navigator and directly to the ticket.
3. The little navigation on the top right hand corner that allows the user to move back and fourth between search results disappears

The e-mail this issue plug-in breaks because it sends the user back to the ticket instead of the Issue Navigator screen, and because of that our users have to keep re-searching so they can mail issues out (it's part of an approval process).

I would imagine this change in workflow would affect other plug-ins too, hence I'm filing this as a Fug.
fields.summary: New Issue Navigator/search breaks plug-ins

Hello,

Is there any way I can allow project leads the ability to add and manage users onto their project without having access to the rest of admin? Unfortunately admin console gives access to everything and I recently had to undo something someone a project someone had started to build in there that they didn't actually need. In most cases most project leads just need access to basic stuff like see who has access to their project and be able to create new users and manage them onto their project not other admin functions...

Thanks!

Louise

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38394].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

When users attempt to submit information through an issue collector, it can randomly display 'Oops! Something went wrong...'. There is no specific information about what that error is.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Setup an issue collector.
# Set the session timeout to 1 minute as per [Changing the default session timeout|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA062/Changing+the+default+session+timeout].
# Open up the issue collector.
# Wait for the user session to timeout.
# Attempt to submit the form.

h3. Expected Results

The collector displays a specific error about how the user's session has timed out.

h3. Actual Results

The 'Oops! Something went wrong...' error appears.

h3. Workaround

Increase the session timeout as per [Changing the default session timeout|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA062/Changing+the+default+session+timeout].

h3. Notes

There are at least two ways to trigger this problem. Let's imagine the session timeout is 10 minutes.
* Scenario A
** T=0m: The user opens the feedback collector
** T=0m: A new anonymous session is created (i.e. the user receives a JSESSIONID)
** T=11m: The user submits the form. The JSESSIONID has timed out and it triggers the 401 response.

* Scenario B
** T=0m: The user opens the feedback collector and receives an anonymous session (for example, JSESSIONID=123)
** T=1m: The user submits the feedback. Everything is ok at this point. The JSESSIONID=123 is still valid
** T=9m: The user opens the feedback collector again. As they still have a valid JSESSIONID, no new session is created
** T=11m: They submit the feedback using JSESSIONID=123. This session is now timed out, so they receive the 401.
fields.summary: Issue Collector displays 'Oops! Something went wrong...' if the user's session times out

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38388].
  {panel}

h3.Background
JIRA always expects the user-tier for JIRA and plugins to be compatible. Which means that whenever a JIRA license having a different user tier is applied, it is highly likely that several plugins get disabled.

h3.Improvement Requests
h4.1. Provide warning on license update page
* Provide a warning on the license update page to make administrators aware that plugins which are licensed based on user tier could be disabled due to incompatible user tier.
{panel:borderColor=#ccc|bgColor=#FFFFCE}
(!) JIRA plugins may stop working if the new license has a different user-tier from the active. Please ensure that plugins which have licensing based on user-tier are also updated immediately to prevent them getting disabled due to incompatible user-tier.
{panel}

!License-Warning.png!

h4.2. Check new license and require confirmation on user-tier change
# Once the user submits the license, check the license if there is difference in user-tier between old and new licenses
# Warn the user again about user-tier changes and impact on plugins and ask for confirmation before proceeding to update the license.

h2.How to fix
The knowledge base article [Incompatible with Product License (wrong type)|https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=372605274] describes the workaround and how to get support.
fields.summary: Warn on license page about JIRA plugins getting disabled due to incompatible with product license type (wrong type) or user tier

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38385].
  {panel}

Project avatar changes immediately after choosing new one in edit window. User do not have to hit "Update" in "Project edit window". This leads to situation, that  when we have different avatar in main project administration screen and differenc if we hit edit second time. If we reload project admin screen, we get new avatar.

Steps to reproduce the problem:

1. Go to project admin page
2. Hit edit
3. Choose new avatart
4. Hit cancel
5. See that main avatar is still the old one, however if user hits edit project second time will see new avatar. 

I believe that if we have Cancel button we should be able to undo the canges in the form.
fields.summary: Project avatar updates even when user hits cancel

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38371].
  {panel}

I am working with releases lately, so I decided to configure our CONFDEV project for the Fix Version to be mandatory - so I can take advantage of the JIRA Release Reports.

I want the _Fix Version_ field to be required in some of transitions to RESOLVED. But I want this field to be required only if the _Resolution_ field is equals to FIXED. 

Having mandatory fields when the value does not apply sometimes it's not good. If we resolve an issue with _Resolution = Won't Fix_, we don't really need the _Fix Version_ to be filled in. 

I might be wrong, as I am not an advance JIRA Admin, but I think JIRA does not allow us to do that for now.
fields.summary: As a JIRA Admin, I would like to configure a transition to force a field to be required only if another field has a specific value

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38352].
  {panel}

This has bitten me several times now while trying to work w/JIRA this morning.

While editing a Story, accidentally hitting "ESC" would _immediately_ cancel all of my edits and discard them.

Having been a vim user for 20+yrs, muscle memory leads me to hit ESC when I'm done an edit, but in JIRA that results in the immediate loss of all of the changes I've made, even when hit accidentally.

While I see [JRA-36670], where an Atlassian representative indicates that this is a "feature" and not a "bug", I believe he's incorrect.  Even after having disabled all Keyboard Shortcuts in JIRA, this accidental keypress causes immediate loss of work.

I'd be inclined to think that when Keyboard Shortcuts are disabled, that this keypress either no longer functions, or that it at least presents a warning/dialog to the user rather than immediately discarding all changes.

Further, I'd be hard pressed to believe that Atlassian's formal response would be "if you want to do any serious editing, *don't* do it our platform; use your own editor and then copy/paste it in".
fields.summary: Hitting ESC while editing issue immediately discards edits
Favourite Filter Widget: Enable display of Story point sum in addition to Issue counts under Favourite filters

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38346].
  {panel}

h3. Current behaviour

When you search for a new plugin in the "Find new Add-Ons" section in JIRA Administration, you will have the option to "Buy" or "Free Trial" for the plugins. For an user who already has a license or a expired one, it is not clear what is the correct option.

h3. Expected behaviour

Modify one of the existing ones to clarify what has to be done for the user who already has the license (maybe a simple "Install" option) and remove "Free Trial" if that domain have already tried the add-on.
fields.summary: Clarify the options to install plugins in JIRA
